title: Decay - nucleons in beta-minus decay of cesium-137

content.question: The nucleus of a cesium-<math alttext="137" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>137</mn></math> atom has <math alttext="55" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>55</mn></math> protons and <math alttext="82" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>82</mn></math> neutrons. If a cesium-<math alttext="137" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>137</mn></math> nucleus undergoes beta-minus decay, how many protons and neutrons are in the resulting nucleus?

choices.label: <math alttext="54" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>54</mn></math> protons and <math alttext="83" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>83</mn></math> neutrons
<math alttext="55" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>55</mn></math> protons and <math alttext="81" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>81</mn></math> neutrons
<math alttext="56" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>56</mn></math> protons and <math alttext="81" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>81</mn></math> neutrons
<math alttext="56" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>56</mn></math> protons and <math alttext="82" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>82</mn></math> neutrons

content.answer: <math alttext="56" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>56</mn></math> protons and <math alttext="81" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>81</mn></math> neutrons

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
